gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - GaPbBa_bottles from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dissolved Ga, Pb, and Ba from GEOTRACES Rosette bottles from GT10 and GT11 cruises. Dataset Description: <p>Lab-based measurements of dissolved Ga, Pb, and Ba from GEOTRACES Rosette bottles from the 2010 and 2011 US GEOTRACES cruises (GT10 and GT11). <strong>Please be aware that the dataset status is "final with updates expected". The investigators expect to have revised numbers for some samples. </strong>This dataset will be updated once those revised data are submitted.</p><p>Please note that some US GEOTRACES data may not be final, pending intercalibration results and further analysis. If you are interested in following changes to US GEOTRACES NAT data, there is an RSS feed available via the BCO-DMO <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066">US GEOTRACES project page</a> (scroll down and expand the "Datasets" section).</p> Acquisition Description: <p>The samples were collected for trace metal determinations at various stations from the RV Knorr using a custom-built US GEOTRACES trace metal clean rosette consisting of an epoxy painted Al rosette frame containing 24x12 L GO-FLO bottles (Cutter and Bruland, 2012). Immediately after the rosette was recovered, the tops of the GO-FLO bottles were covered with plastic bags and the bottles were removed from the frame and carried into the US GEOTRACES clean van for sub-sampling. The GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to 10 psi using 0.2 µm-filtered compressed air and samples were filtered through 0.2 µm Acropak or membrane filters. All sub-sampling was undertaken in the clean van using rigorous trace metal protocols. Additional surface water samples were collected from a clean underway sampling system and similarly filtered.<br /><br />Ga, Pb, and Ba were determined by isotope dilution ICP-MS using a ThermoFisher Element 2 operated in low resolution. For Ga and Pb, samples were concentrated using Mg(OH)2 co-precipitation (Shiller &amp; Bairamadgi, 2006; Zurbrick et al., 2012) while Ba was determined following 20-fold dilution in dilute nitric acid (Shim et al., 2012).</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Cutter</strong>, G.A. and K.W. Bruland, 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnol. Oceanogr. Methods 10: 425-436, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a><br /><strong>Shiller</strong>, A.M and G.R. Bairamadgi, 2006. Dissolved Gallium in the Northwest Pacific and the South and Central Atlantic Oceans: Implications for Aeolian Fe Input and a Reconsideration of Profiles. Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems 7, Q08M09, doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2005GC001118" target="_blank">10.1029/2005GC001118</a><br /><strong>Shim</strong>, M.-J., P.S. Swarzenski, and A.M. Shiller. Dissolved and Colloidal Trace Elements in the Mississippi River Delta Outflow after Hurricanes Katrina and Rita, 2012. Continental Shelf Research 42: 1-9, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.csr.2012.03.007" target="_blank">10.1016/j.csr.2012.03.007</a><br /><strong>Zurbrick</strong>, C.M., P. Morton, C. Gallon, A. Shiller, W.M. Landing, and A.R. Flegal, 2012. Intercalibration of cadmium and lead concentration measurements in the northwest Pacific Ocean. Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 270-277. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.270" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.270</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0927951 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=0927951&HistoricalAwards=false

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Marine Science 1020 Balch Blvd.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31473.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31474.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: text Description: GEOTRACES cruise identifier. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31475.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'STNNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31476.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'CASTNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31477.rdf Name: date Units: YYYYmmdd Description: Date (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31478.rdf Name: month Units: mm (01 to 12) Description: 2-digit month of year (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31479.rdf Name: day Units: dd (01 to 31) Description: 2-digit day of month (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31480.rdf Name: year Units: YYYY Description: 4-digit year (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31481.rdf Name: time Units: HHMM Description: Time in HHMM format; 24-hour clock (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31482.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude. North = Positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31483.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude. West = Negative. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31484.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'BTLNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31485.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_SAMPNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31486.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'CTDDEPTH', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31487.rdf Name: Ga Units: pmol/kg Description: Dissolved gallium (Ga) in pmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31488.rdf Name: Ga_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for 'Ga'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31489.rdf Name: Pb Units: pmol/kg Description: Dissolved lead (Pb) in pmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31490.rdf Name: Pb_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for 'Pb'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31491.rdf Name: Ba Units: nmol/kg Description: Dissolved barium (Ba) in nmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31492.rdf Name: Ba_flag Units: unitless Description: Quality flag for 'Ba'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33133.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.ssZ Description: Cast date/time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated from original date and time fields. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33134.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33135.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: unitless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33136.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/YEARXXXX/ Name: Year since birth of Christ Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES cruise identifier.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'STNNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'CASTNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Date (UTC).; General Description: UTC month, day and year, usually as a text string, e.g. feb10_1995. It is better to use one of the other forms of presenting date and time data so that the data can be used in computations and for comparisons. Note, if the string begins with numbers but also includes letters, there may be problems using the field name for retrieval. Use date_gmt for future data sets.
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit month of year (UTC).; General Description: month of year, utc time, Use month_gmt for future data sets.
PI-supplied Description: 2-digit day of month (UTC).; General Description: day, UTC time, Use the name day_gmt for future data sets.

PI-supplied Description: 4-digit year (UTC).; General Description: year, reported as YYYY, e.g. 1995 NERC Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ.
PI-supplied Description: Time in HHMM format; 24-hour clock (UTC).; General Description: UTC time, using 2400 clock format

PI-supplied Description: Latitude. North = Positive.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude. West = Negative.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'BTLNBR', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: rosette bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'GEOTRC_SAMPNO', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters, calculated from CTD pressure. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'CTDDEPTH', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved gallium (Ga) in pmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for 'Ga'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved lead (Pb) in pmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for 'Pb'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved barium (Ba) in nmol/kg seawater; determined at the University of Southern Mississippi.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for 'Ba'; based on WOCE bottle flags:2= good;3 = questionable;4 = bad;5 = not reported;9 = sample not drawn from this bottle.; General Description: quality flag; based on a PI established code; identifies a problem/quality issue with sample(s) from a given water bottle or single observation

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cast date/time (UTC) formatted to ISO8601 standard. T indicates start of time string; Z indicates UTC. Calculated from original date and time fields.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events.Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>The samples were collected for trace metal determinations at various stations from the RV Knorr using a custom-built US GEOTRACES trace metal clean rosette consisting of an epoxy painted Al rosette frame containing 24x12 L GO-FLO bottles (Cutter and Bruland, 2012). Immediately after the rosette was recovered, the tops of the GO-FLO bottles were covered with plastic bags and the bottles were removed from the frame and carried into the US GEOTRACES clean van for sub-sampling. The GO-FLO bottles were pressurized to 10 psi using 0.2 µm-filtered compressed air and samples were filtered through 0.2 µm Acropak or membrane filters. All sub-sampling was undertaken in the clean van using rigorous trace metal protocols. Additional surface water samples were collected from a clean underway sampling system and similarly filtered.<br /><br />Ga, Pb, and Ba were determined by isotope dilution ICP-MS using a ThermoFisher Element 2 operated in low resolution. For Ga and Pb, samples were concentrated using Mg(OH)2 co-precipitation (Shiller &amp; Bairamadgi, 2006; Zurbrick et al., 2012) while Ba was determined following 20-fold dilution in dilute nitric acid (Shim et al., 2012).</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br /><strong>Cutter</strong>, G.A. and K.W. Bruland, 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnol. Oceanogr. Methods 10: 425-436, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a><br /><strong>Shiller</strong>, A.M and G.R. Bairamadgi, 2006. Dissolved Gallium in the Northwest Pacific and the South and Central Atlantic Oceans: Implications for Aeolian Fe Input and a Reconsideration of Profiles. Geochemistry, Geophysics, Geosystems 7, Q08M09, doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2005GC001118" target="_blank">10.1029/2005GC001118</a><br /><strong>Shim</strong>, M.-J., P.S. Swarzenski, and A.M. Shiller. Dissolved and Colloidal Trace Elements in the Mississippi River Delta Outflow after Hurricanes Katrina and Rita, 2012. Continental Shelf Research 42: 1-9, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.csr.2012.03.007" target="_blank">10.1016/j.csr.2012.03.007</a><br /><strong>Zurbrick</strong>, C.M., P. Morton, C. Gallon, A. Shiller, W.M. Landing, and A.R. Flegal, 2012. Intercalibration of cadmium and lead concentration measurements in the northwest Pacific Ocean. Limnology &amp; Oceanography: Methods 10: 270-277. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.270" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.270</a></p>

<p>Quality flag:&nbsp; Assignment of quality flag is based on analytical and methodological considerations in conjunction with examination of profiles and replicate analyses.&nbsp; Scheme is based on WOCE bottle flags: good (2), questionable (3), bad (4), not reported (5), and sample not drawn from this bottle (9).<br /><br />Reporting units are pico- or nano-moles per kg-seawater. Missing data were identified by '-999'.<br /><br />Precision: Ga = 6.5% at 30 pmol/kg; Pb = 2.2% at 28 pmol/kg; Ba = 3% at 37 nmol/kg<br />Limit of detection: Ga = 2 pmol/kg; Pb = 1.9 pmol/kg; Ba = 0.7 nmol/kg</p><p>BCO-DMO made the following modifications:<br />- values of '-999' were replaced with 'nd'.<br />- parameter names were modified to conform with BCO-DMO naming conventions.<br />- added ISO_DateTime_UTC from the original date and time field provided by PI.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle PI Supplied Instrument Description:The samples were collected for trace metal determinations at various stations from the RV Knorr using a custom-built US GEOTRACES trace metal clean rosette consisting of an epoxy painted Al rosette frame containing 24x12 L GO-FLO bottles. Instrument Name: GO-FLO Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Instrument Description: GO-FLO bottle cast used to collect water samples for pigment, nutrient, plankton, etc. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is specially designed to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Ga, Pb, and Ba were determined by isotope dilution ICP-MS using a ThermoFisher Element 2 operated in low resolution. Instrument Name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:ICP Mass Spec Instrument Description: An ICP Mass Spec is an instrument that passes nebulized samples into an inductively-coupled gas plasma (8-10000 K) where they are atomized and ionized. Ions of specific mass-to-charge ratios are quantified in a quadrupole mass spectrometer. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB15/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
